snippet: Federal authorities said they arrested Glenn Adam Chin, the head pharmacist of the New England Compounding Center, whose contaminated drugs led to 64 deaths.
abstract: Federal authorities make first arrest in case of New England Compounding Center, whose tainted steroid pain medication killed dozens of people nationwide in 2012; detain Glen Adam Chin, who was head pharmacist at company, at Logan International Airport as he attempted to leave country.
lead_paragraph: Federal authorities said they arrested Glenn Adam Chin, the head pharmacist of the New England Compounding Center, whose contaminated drugs led to 64 deaths.

headline.main: First Arrest Made in 2012 Steroid Medication Deaths
headline.print_headline: First Arrest Made in Case of Drug Maker Whose Tainted Steroids Killed Dozens in ’12
